content: Singaporean author, poet and musician **Damien Sin**, born **Foong Yu Lei** (1965 â€“ 2011), was a Singaporean [writer](/wiki/Writer), [poet](/wiki/Poet) and [musician](/wiki/Musician). He has written several bestselling books published by the Angsana Books [imprint](/wiki/Imprint_(trade_name)) of publisher Flame Of The Forest Publishing. Sin died in 2011. ## Career After failing his 'A' Levels, Sin started his career as a karaoke-jockey before he turned to writing erotic stories while he was in detention for a drug offence. He was a member of [Russell Lee](/wiki/Russell_Lee_(writer))'s team of ghost writers. Sin also wrote the screenplay of the critically acclaimed film, *[Mee Pok Man](/wiki/Mee_Pok_Man)* (1995), which launched director [Eric Khoo](/wiki/Eric_Khoo)'s career. Its story was based on Sin's short story "One Last Cold Kiss", which appeared in *Classic Singapore Horror Stories: Book 2* (1994). Khoo later dedicated his film *[In the Room](/wiki/In_the_Room_(2015_film))* (2015) to Sin. Sin was also the frontman of two bands: Fairweather Friends, whose music appeared on various [Pony Canyon](/wiki/Pony_Canyon) compilations released in Singapore in the 1990s, including *Dazed and Confused*, and Transformer, whose other members went on to form [Zircon Lounge](/wiki/Zircon_Lounge). As a solo singer-songwriter, he performed at [The Substation](/wiki/The_Substation) in Singapore under the name 'The Hardcore Troubadour'. ## Death Sin died in 2011. ## Bibliography - *Classic Singapore Horror Stories: Book 1* (1992) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9810032439 - *Classic Singapore Horror Stories: Book 2* (1994) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9813056126 - *Tall Tales and Short Stories* (1995) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9813056134 - *Saints, Sinners and Singaporeans: A Collection of Poems* (1998) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9813056177 - *Classic Singapore Horror Stories: Book 3* (2000) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9813056401 - *Classic Singapore Horror Stories: Book 4* (2003) [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 9813056681 - Damien Sin on the Flame Of The Forest website - Bibliography on FantasticFiction.co.uk This article about a Singaporean writer is a stub.
